properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 2:48AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...Heavy precip brings lower elevation snow tonight...

.Storm reports and ODOT cameras are suggesting snow levels are
crashing down to 1500 feet under some heavy precipitation this
evening. Snow will likely continue to accumulate around 1500 feet
this morning under the heavy precipitation.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow
expected. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds
could gust as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory
above 1500 feet, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of
2 to 4 inches. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning: Portions of western
Siskiyou County including Sawyers Bar Road and Highway 3 south
of Callahan. The Winter Weather Advisory includes Highway 3,
Highway 96, as well as Fort Jones, Happy Camp, Etna, Greenview
and the surrounding hills of Klamath River and Scott Bar.

* WHEN...Through 4 PM PST Thursday. Snow amounts will be
decreasing through the day.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact morning and evening travel.
Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET
